intro: Anthriscus vandasii, commonly known as the Vanda's parsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white umbellate flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species.
